text:
ITE & MICE Hong Kong 2016 to cover affluent travel in Asia’s major source markets Published on : Tuesday, September 22, 2015
ITE & MICE, Hong Kong’s annual international travel fair, covers regional visitors in two trade days and Hong Kong’s affluent FIT travelers in two public days, by effectively combining a trade and public fair each with its own program. Both trade and public days focus on affluent, in-depth and theme travels!
Over 20 seminars for travel trade or on MICE and corporate travel, and Trade Award Presentations etc were held in trade days, which require registration for admission. Also, Workshop / Business Matching for sellers is held for sellers meeting different buyers in one room for efficient identification of potential business partners. In addition, the organizer will use pre-show e-newsletters to promote exhibitors’ trade seminars for pre-registration etc.
In public days were nearly 100 travel seminars, with some hosted by travel writers or even celebrities, which were well attended by affluent and sophisticated FIT travelers, cultural performances, 3-D photo sessions, demos and special displays on theme travel, and special offers by some exhibitors!
Trendy travel themes highlighted and featured in ITE & MICE, through special displays and seminars etc, include Cruise, Driving & Study Tours, Sport & Eco-tourism, Honeymoon & Overseas Wedding, Travel Photography, Wellness & Medical Tourism.
Results are encouraging! ITE & MICE 2015 drew 11874 buyers and visitors (76% from Hong Kong & 18% from China; 6198 from travel agents & 2534 from MICE), and 78116 public visitors (81% prefer FIT & 5% private groups), and from 50 countries and regions 607 exhibitors with 85% from abroad.
Hong Kong, itself Asia’s 4th largest source market and a trendsetter for China’s wealthy, last year spent US$22.8 billion on international travel and her 7.2 million citizens made 86 million departures! The neighboring Pearl River Delta is both an economic powerhouse and a major source market.
Thus, exhibitors can cover in-depth the two major source markets of Hong Kong and Southern China, promote to regional travel trade, MICE and FIT, conduct channel and direct sale, all under the one roof of ITE & MICE! Other free and optional services such as sponsorship etc are also available.
The next ITE & MICE will be held from June 16 to 19, 2016 at Halls 1A to 1E of the Hong Kong Convention & Exhibition Centre. Organized by TKS Exhibition Services Ltd, ITE & MICE is supported by China National Tourism Administration, Hong Kong Tourism Board, Travel Industry Council of Hong Kong, Macau Government Tourist Office, organizations and associations of travel trade and event industry in the region.
